thread.section_title: Rapid TV News - Broadcast Technology Daily
thread.title: Lionsgate signs VOD licensing agreement with iQIYI
thread.title_full: Lionsgate signs VOD licensing agreement with iQIYI

title: Lionsgate signs VOD licensing agreement with iQIYI
text:
Editor | 12 October 2015 
Claiming to be responding to the growing demand for premium content Lionsgate has signed a long-term output deal with China's iQIYI. 
Claimed to be owner of China's largest comprehensive online video platform with over 5,000 million unique users, iQIYI will have exclusive subscription and transactional video-on-demand ( SVOD and TVOD ) window rights for Lionsgate franchises, potential tent-poles and star-driven event films. It will also be able to make major promotional commitment on its platform for content such as Hunger Games Mockingjay 2, Allegiant, Now You See Me 2, Sicario and Deepwater Horizon. 
"We're thrilled to partner with iQIYI, a major game changer and one of the largest and fastest-growing digital platforms in China," commented Lionsgate executive vice president of international sales Wendy Reeds. "They will provide a quality showcase for our slate of high profile event movies, and our agreement underscores our commitment to innovation and leadership in delivering premium content to online audiences around the world." 
Added iQIYI senior vice president Yang Xianghua: "In China, more and more people are paying to watch movies online. iQIYI has the largest online movie library in China and we have been actively purchasing premium movie content and building in-depth partnerships with industry players. We have enjoyed a positive long term relationship with Lionsgate and with this agreement we are delighted to extend and deepen our cooperation to areas including broadcast, promotion and distribution."
